action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 9475

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"B21": 944, "B00": 568, "A08": 515, "A27": 239, "B94": 876, "B53": 421, "A23": 991, "C65": 281, "A89": 788, "B67": 678, "B45": 432, "C34": 409, "C12": 279, "A05": 506, "B60": 101, "C92": 686, "B69": 851, "A84": 854, "C06": 133, "B12": 192, "A16": 573, "B85": 17, "C35": 465, "B10": 772, "C15": 46, "B09": 501, "B16": 220, "C81": 404, "A58": 843, "C24": 748, "A30": 552, "A66": 843, "B75": 947, "B46": 345, "C70": 930}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"B21": 138, "B00": 583, "A08": 868, "A27": 822, "B94": 783, "B53": 65, "A23": 262, "C65": 121, "A89": 508, "B67": 780, "B45": 461, "C34": 484, "C12": 668, "A05": 389, "B60": 808, "C92": 215, "B69": 97, "A84": 500, "C06": 30, "B12": 915, "A16": 856, "B85": 400, "C35": 444, "B10": 623, "C15": 781, "B09": 786, "B16": 3, "C81": 713, "A58": 457, "C24": 273, "A30": 739, "A66": 822, "B75": 235, "B46": 606, "C70": 968}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format only once at the very beginning of every one of your messages and not more often. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.
action.label: context

action.content:
Okay, let's start by understanding the problem. I need to negotiate a set of items with another participant, maximizing my own importance while keeping the total effort under 9475. The key is that I don't know the other person's importance values, so I have to make decisions based on my own data and some strategic reasoning.

First, I should calculate the total effort of all items to see if it's possible to take everything. Let me sum up all the effort values. Let's see:

Looking at the item effort dictionary:

B21:944, B00:568, A08:515, A27:239, B94:876, B53:421, A23:991, C65:281, A89:788, B67:678, B45:432, C34:409, C12:279, A05:506, B60:101, C92:686, B69:851, A84:854, C06:133, B12:192, A16:573, B85:17, C35:465, B10:772, C15:46, B09:501, B16:220, C81:404, A58:843, C24:748, A30:552, A66:843, B75:947, B46:345, C70:930.

So the first step is to figure out which items to include. Since my goal is to maximize my own importance, I should prioritize items with high importance relative to their effort. That is, items where importance/effort ratio is high. This is similar to the knapsack problem where you maximize value per weight.

Let me calculate the importance/effort ratio for each item. Let's list them:

B21: 138/944 ≈ 0.146

B00: 583/568 ≈ 1.026

A08: 868/515 ≈ 1.685

A27: 822/239 ≈ 3.439

C92: 215/686 ≈ 0.313

B69: 97/851 ≈ 0.114

C06: 30/133 ≈ 0.226

B12: 915/192 ≈ 4.766

A16: 856/573 ≈ 1.494

B85: 400/17 ≈ 23.529 (extremely high)

C35: 444/465 ≈ 0.955

B10: 623/772 ≈ 0.807

C15: 781/46 ≈ 16.978 (very high)

B09: 786/501 ≈ 1.569

B16: 3/220 ≈ 0.014

C81: 713/404 ≈ 1.765

A58: 457/843 ≈ 0.542

C24: 273/748 ≈ 0.365

A30: 739/552 ≈ 1.339

A66: 822/843 ≈ 0.975

B75: 235/947 ≈ 0.248

B46: 606/345 ≈ 1.757

C70: 968/930 ≈ 1.041

So the highest ratios are B85 (23.5), C15 (16.98), B12 (4.77), A27 (3.44), B60 (8.0), etc. 

So the strategy would be to include items with the highest importance/effort ratios first, as they give the most bang for the effort. 

But I need to make sure that the total effort doesn't exceed 9475. Let's start building a set by adding the highest ratio items first.

Start with B85 (effort 17, importance 400). Then C15 (effort 46, importance 781). Then B12 (effort 192, importance 915). Then A27 (effort 239, importance 822). Then B60 (effort 101, importance 808). Then C34 (effort 409, importance 484). Then B67 (effort 678, importance 780). Then A08 (effort 515, importance 868). Then B00 (effort 568, importance 583). Then A30 (effort 552, importance 739). Then A66 (effort 843, importance 822). Then B46 (effort 345, importance 606). Then C70 (effort 930, importance 968). Then A58 (effort 843, importance 457). Then C81 (effort 404, importance 713). Wait, but adding all these would definitely exceed the limit. So I need to calculate the cumulative effort as I add each item. Let's start adding step by step:

So up to step 20, total effort is 9409. Then adding B69 would go over. So the next item after 20 is B69, which is too much. So maybe we can add some other items instead. Let's check the remaining items. After step 20, the remaining items are B69, B53, C65, A23, B21, B75, B45, C92.

A23 (991): 9409+991=10400, over. B21 (944): 9409+944=10353, over. B75 (947): 9409+947=10356, over. B45 (432): 9409+432=9841, over. C92 (686): 9409+686=10095, over. So none of the remaining items can be added without exceeding the limit. 

So the maximum set we can get is up to step 20, which is 9409 effort. But maybe there's a better combination. For example, maybe replacing some items with others to get a higher total importance. 

Alternatively, perhaps the initial selection is not optimal. Let me check if there's a better way. For example, maybe some items with lower ratios but higher importance could be included if they fit. 

Alternatively, maybe the initial approach is correct, but I need to check if there's a way to include more items by adjusting the order. 

But given the time constraints, perhaps the best approach is to propose a set that includes the highest ratio items up to the limit. 

So the proposed set would be: B85, C15, B12, A27, B60, C34, B67, A08, B00, A30, A66, B46, C70, A58, C81, B10, C24, A16, B09, C06.

But maybe there's a way to include more items. For example, after step 20 (9409), maybe we can add some items with lower effort. Let's see. The remaining items are B69 (851), B53 (421), C65 (281), A23 (991), B21 (944), B75 (947), B45 (432), C92 (686). 

The effort left is 9475 - 9409 = 66. So we can only add items with effort ≤66. Looking at the remaining items, none of them have effort ≤66. The smallest is B53 (421), which is way over. So no. 

Alternatively, maybe we can remove some items to make room for others. For example, if we remove a high effort item and add a lower one. But since the goal is to maximize my own importance, it's better to keep the high importance items. 

Alternatively, maybe the initial selection is optimal. 

So the proposal would be the set of items up to step 20. 

But I need to make sure that this set is within the limit. 9409 is under 9475. So that's acceptable. 

Now, the next step is to propose this set. But I need to structure the message with the PROPOSAL tag.
